item.description: I am, as of July 2019, a PostDoc at the International Conflict Research Group at ETH Zurich and a visiting researcher at Harvard University’s IQSS. My research and dissertation focuses on state building in twentieth century Africa and its effects on local development and conflict. At ETH Zurich, I am part of the ERC NASTAC project, which analyzes the interplay between nationalism and state (trans)formation in Europe. Furthermore, I work on the effects of local ethnic demography on pre-election violence and ethnic favoritism in Africa.
